WRITING.TITLE: How does Instagram know my phone number?
WRITING.TEXT: I"ve experienced something really weird. Is there a way that IG is able to detect the phone number of the SIM card in your phone? I've literally never entered my phone number into my Instagram account. It is a business account, but I want to keep my number private. Yet somehow today I received this weird notification inside the app prompting me to enter my phone number as a security measure. But the strange thing is that within this message, it actually had my current phone number. #8203; The message said something to the effect of: "enter your phone number: \*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* (my number) into your profile details". How did they get my phone number in the first place??? Do they trace the phone number of your SIM card? Is it a matter of other contacts having your number? Please can someone explain, and have you experienced anything similar.

No, I've never done so. So this really weird. I didn't enter my phone number nevertheless. But I can't understand how they managed to get it to start with... I don't know if would be too drastic to change my phone number now or what.

Hi there. I've been experiencing something very similar to what you have described. When I think something, someone says precisely what I said out loud, or it happens sometime later. I've also had many other experiences similar to this. I just took interest in you question because I'm the same, but unfortunately I cannot answer why or what this is. All I can say is, you're defo not crazy lol

I'm not psychic or at least I don't believe I am. I don't belong to this subreddit either. I was just on here looking for answers in the same way as you, because I can't explain some of the uncanny occurrences that have happened to me. #8203; I actually consider myself more "logically minded" if that makes sense, like I would typically seek rational answers to things as opposed to just believing the paranormal. However, based on the experiences I've had which are very similar to what you're describing, I can't help but feel there really is something else at play. #8203; Even the real-time experience you described. There was an occasion where I was typing out a comment on a friend's instagram post, and right then, the radio host said precisely what I wrote in a sentence. Coincidence?? idk. It's really weird, I do think we're somehow manifesting our thoughts into the world, and seeing the universe react subsequently. #8203; Anyway, I hope you find the answers you're looking for. And know there's at least one person out there who thinks you're perfectly sane. ;)

WRITING.TITLE: What Wifi Router do you recommend for Google Home/Smart Homes?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm new to the space of smart homes. I've been doing a bit of research before making purchases and getting started with building my own smart home. I've decided I'd like to go for Google Home primarily. My question is whether the wifi router I choose to use matters, and if so, what are the best options available. Interestingly enough I've managed to find articles about recommendations for Alexa, but not really for Google Home? #8203; I live in a double story home with brick interior walls, so I need something that will be strong in terms of connectivity throughout the house. #8203; Should I go for Google Wifi, and are there any other alternatives to look at for optimum performance in my home?
Could be the case , now that you mention it. Just funny he didn't say anything about it... But I suppose I shouldn't simply assume the worst..

WRITING.TITLE: People believe we had conversations that never happened
WRITING.TEXT: I've experienced on a couple of occasions now, that people seem to think we had discussions that never took place. They are convinced that I told them things that I am entirely certain I did not say at any point in time. Today for instance, my dad was telling me that about a year or so ago, I supposedly told him that I was seeing people's faces contorting with blood all over their faces. I was horrified over what he was saying, not only because it sounded really bizarre and grizzly, but also because I know for a fact I did not say any of the above. I'm 100% certain I did not say this. Yet people around me are convinced that things happened that didn't happen, or we had conversations that didn't take place. Not sure if it would have any relevance, but have also been experiencing odd coincidences and synchronicities. My reality feels a little weird overall. Any thoughts?
None of what you've mentioned. Things started going all strange after I experienced a very stressful period in my life. But no drugs, no memory loss that, no diagnosed mental illness.

They're not all as dark as that. Other examples: Some months back I was talking on the phone with a friend of mine about a trip to Cape Town, South Africa with my family I'd gone on a few months prior. I saw a doctor about a week after this conversation with my friend. I was having severe migraines (hence seeing the doctor). Towards the end of the session my doctor was like "so how was your trip to Cape Town?" I was really puzzled because I never mentioned this to him at the beginning of the appointment, or to anyone else at the doctor's office for that matter. He seemed really confused when I asked how he knew about the trip. And he insisted I told him at the beginning. I'm 1000% sure I didn't. Nobody asked me about vacations I'd taken. There was another time my mom was upset because I apparently said that she wanted to steal my jewellery and sell it for money. Again I never said this. This was the cause of a lot of drama, and I was confused as heck. I've had more experiences. This stuff doesn't happen all the time, but today with my dad was the first in a while.
That's a little extreme. Everyone experiences stress and it doesn't just lead to psychosis. Besides, wouldn't I have been committed if that had been the case?
The thing is, I don't suffer from hallucinations. I've never experienced what my dad was describing. So I can't imagine why he'd think I said something like that.

I've experienced exactly what you are describing. People have told me that we had conversations that I know for a fact did not happen. They told me I said things that I know I didn't say to them at any point in time. I have no explanation for this phenomenon, but what you describing is very real.

It's not so much that I was hoping anything would happen. It's just that I wanted understanding as to what is going on and how to make my life return to normal. I understand that I was a little vague in my initial post. I will try to elaborate. I have experienced some inexplicable occurances. As to whether they're entirely negative, I'm not sure, but I view that fact that some seemingly paranormal things have happened, as a negative thing overall. (I prefer normalcy in my life). 1) I have witnessed physical objects moving. Like a pan shifting off the plate while I was cooking. I was alone and this scared me. 4) I also feel like I'm being watched because I actually saw shadow people in my room on an occasion. There were two of them just looking at me. 2) I have encountered people who just seems to know things about me, very personal inward things I've thought about, and things I've done while I was alone. It makes me feel like I'm being watched. This is what bothers me the most. How do they just know things? My doctor just asked me about a trip Cape Town I had been on some months back, and I hadn't mentioned anything about it before to him? 5)There was one time I was describing a scene from a film to my brother, I couldn't remember the name of the film, and then I heard a whisper in my ear telling me what the name was. I was unsure so I went and watched that film (the one that had been whispered to be by something?) only it find that that was in fact the film. The whisper also freaked me out. 6) I know it sounds bizarre. After deciding to start my own business, I have felt pretty down about not earning as much as I had hoped for. I'm still determined to make my business work, but I keep seeing these messages everywhere (like on Instagram captions, or videos on YouTube) saying things like Get a Job! Get a regular Job! (I work from home). It almost feel intentional. Like someone/something is intending me to see it. I accept I may be wrong on this. Also people taking about things I've dreamed about (like the thing with my dad)
I live in a house.
Everything you are saying makes so much sense. Thank you so much for your help :)
How do you know she is stalking you? Does she like/comment on the photos? How do you know?

WRITING.TITLE: Feeling out of place with people
WRITING.TEXT: I really wasn't sure where to post this, but I'm hoping someone can help. I've been wondering whether there is a spiritual reason behind relationships changing drastically between myself and people I would generally get along with, or people who ordinarily wouldn't notice me at all. I'm experiencing a sudden rise in negativity, and also people acting completely out of character. People who generally would be kind and caring (like my family) are now being sarcastic and condescending. And when I sit and genuinely try and place a reason for the shift in how I relate with others, even considering my own flaws I can't find a reason for them to suddenly be behaving so differently towards me. Part of the reason I thought this would be a spiritual issue is because I've also been experiencing number of really wild synchronicities. I feel this odd interconnectedness between things, but it really feels negative and uncomfortable. Some advice would be highly appreciated. Why would people be behaving so differently towards me all of a sudden?

I do ask. I've asked on a number of occasions what the problem is. My my questions are generally met with gaslighting and denial. People don't seem to want to acknowledge their behaviour. The only way I've been able to deal with it is by distancing myself from them, but I feel that eventually I'll be left with very few people in my life.

WRITING.TITLE: When you manifest someone, do they enter you life or into a relationship willingly.
WRITING.TEXT: I'm relatively new to law of attraction and so I don't know a whole lot to be honest. I truly hope I don't upset anyone. I'm just trying to understand the principles of manifesting a person into your life or manifesting a relationship etc. Some months back I saw some videos on how to manifest a text from a particular person. And to my surprise I was successful the first time around. The person texted me, we spoke and after a while they asked me out. I was actually able to do this with a few different people. I couldn't believe it was actually happening. But my question is, is the person actually doing this of their own accord? What inspires them to contact you? Is it really them that's doing it? The reason I ask this, is just that I found that one of the guys, for example, texted me, but it's like they didn't really know why they did it or what to say. Another guy was quite rude actually, and I got the sense that he didn't actually want to hang out with me, and so I didn't understand why he reached out in the first place. Like what was the point if they weren't genuinely interested? Loa is great and all, but I'm bothered by the feeling that people are just puppets, doing something solely because I asked. Does it come from a real place?

WRITING.TITLE: Life feels fake. Is this a delusion?
WRITING.TEXT: Over the last few months, I have increasingly felt like my life is governed and controlled by some unseen entity/force. Things that should feel arbitrary and random, somehow feel orchestrated or staged. Sometimes too convenient. Like something or someone is very knowingly messing with me. What brought this feeling on, is the experience of very inexplicable coincidences. Some call them synchroncities. They feel very uncanny and deliberate. I feel like sometimes people just say the right things, like very specific to what I've already been thinking. Which feels odd. I sometimes feel like I don't really get a perspective different to mine, when I reach out to other people. I don't know how to rid myself of the feeling that something greater than me is out there and is at play in my life. Knowing and calculating my every move. Is this a delusion?
I'm glad to hear I'm not alone in this. I know precisely how you feel. I really hope there's a way out of this mindset to make life simpler.
I plan to call a psychiatrist very soon. Hopefully they can assist me in the midst of this corona thing.
Thank you very much. This was very insightful. I'll definitely look into what you've suggested.
Yes it does. Has it stopped on your side? And if so, how did you achieve that?
This should be impossible, irrespective. The "coincidences" are too telling. And they are real. How is this happening. I'm not disregarding you're saying btw.
Thanks for your response. By constantly reacting, do you mean the acknowledgement that I see it? In other words, to stop seeing it, do stop I recognising or acknowledging?
Thanks, that makes a lot sense.

gt;We are not taught to seek for external signs withing LOA philosophy Thanks for your response. Just in reference to what you're saying. I read a couple of times in this subreddit reference to something called "birds before land". Wouldn't this concept (if it is true) be an external sign of something happening? Please understand, I am not wanting this to be the case at all. I'm simply learning and understanding as you are saying external signs don't mean anything. Thanks in advance.

gt;Signs are confusing. What do they mean? Whose schedule of meaning do you use? etc. Agreed, 100%. But if you don't mind (please bare with me). Are signs and indicators not the same? It kind of seems like semantics to me. Please and thank you.
Lol. Thank you for all your replies. I'm not sure about your radio analogy and what it means. But I'm putting this to rest now, haha. Cheers!

WRITING.TITLE: Why do the things you don't want, come so easily?
WRITING.TEXT: There are times in my life where I've taken preventative measures to ensure something doesn't occur, and yet somehow it does. For instance, there were people in my life I was actively trying to avoid, and so did everything I could to separate myself from them to ensure we don't encounter each other again. I felt a sort of comfort in the measures I'd taken. I felt for sure I'd never see or hear from them again, and somehow, they still find their way to me. Also when I've fleetingly told myself, I don't want someone to ask me for something, then they do. But the positive fleeting thoughts don't happen. I'm just questioning, why is it, when you do want something to happen, according to LOA, you must meditate and then forget about it. However when you don't want something to happen, thinking about it often makes it happen. Why is this the law.

gt;Yup, LOA 101, you can't take action from a place of lack or it will backfire on you. Can you kindly elaborate on this? What do you mean a place of lack? Are you saying, if don't want it, it's sure to happen? #8203; gt;Everything you are practicing isn't LOA. I'm literally learning. Discovering.Not really so heavily practicing. What I've written about here is more my general life experience. Not so much what I've actively practised. But I'm aware that you can unwittingly attract things or situations.

WRITING.TITLE: Is it true that you're not supposed to Detach/Let Go? Conflicting information, please help.
WRITING.TEXT: Someone told me the other day in this subreddit, that apparently you're not supposed to detach/let go when manifesting, or that it's unnecessary. Is this true? It goes against everything I've seen about it online. Literally everyone says (including posts in this subreddit) that you're supposed to "let go" and not constantly think about your desires. The person also suggest that this is "misinformation". I just need clarity on the matter. Thoughts?
Fair enough? Really, though? I thought your differentiation between nondirective and concentrative meditation was a good argument. Why do you change your mind?

Report the account for stealing your intellectual property. If the content is entirely yours, you created it completely, then you are able to report this on instagram. I would look into that if she creates a new account.

It could possibly be that he visits your profile often. I remember reading, several months back, some reddit discussions where people had experimented and found that people who frequent your profile appear higher up in your story view. I'm not entirely sure if this was ever the case, or if it still is. But it's a possibility.
no, I think they'll just ban the one offending account

A lot of bot accounts look like that. Some people do make throw away accounts that they don't actually intend to post on, but simply use to view other people's posts. But it could also likely be someone you know, who knows? Edit: I agree with the other user, just block the account.

Try log in on the the instagram website and see if it will allow you. That way can confirm that your account isn't hacked or anything. If you are able to log in there, then try delete the app and download it again and log in again. Good luck!

gt;it doesn't even access the [www.instagram.com](http://www.instagram.com/) website That's very odd.Perhaps try from a different computer? Or is there someone else's phone available to you. I don't know what to say if the actual website doesn't appear for you, as it is working perfectly on my side. You could try turn your wifi off and on and see. Good luck! Edit: I see you used your cellphone browser. It might be a device issue. Definitely try from a computer to confirm.

gt;What if it's just a complete stranger? I didn't mean it like that. In all probability it is just some random person. That's most likely the case as there are millions of users on instagram, and there are also many bot accounts which don't have a real person behind them at all. I don't think there's any real cause for concern. Wasn't trying to frighten you. Take care.
I have actually experienced that. It is common if your account is public. Just block it if it is bothering you.

Do you mean multiple pictures in one post? Or several different posts? If it's there first one, then this is how [https://help.instagram.com/269314186824048](https://help.instagram.com/269314186824048) however, this is for mobile. Not sure if you can upload multiple pictures in the web browser on computer.
I've had several instances of exactly this type of thing happening. Don't know how or why but they're doing it.

My account is public, so my stories sometimes get viewed by accounts that I'm not familiar with. But with the empty accounts specifically (as you've described) it is not a frequent experience. Is there someone that you've blocked, who could possibly be trying to have access to your account again? If not then, it's probably just some random person or a bot account.

I think you are overthinking this whole thing, and possibly a little paranoid, no offence. To start, I hope you really have left her alone, for her sake and your sake. Don't stalk her. To answer you question, how would she just know it was you, if you made a fake account. There's no way to know that. If the account was public, then I'm sure she's aware that any random person could end up there. But again, I hope you've stopped doing that. And also, it's probably just a random person on your account. Don't overthink it. Cheers!

Hey, I haven't been on instagram in a while, but I can give you some advice from when I was using it. I was having some issues with my explore page at one stage, but I managed to sort it out. You're going to have to keep doing this until it comes right. So basically, if you open the particular on your explore page, click on those three dots at the top. In the menu that pops up, there should be an option for "not interested" or something to that effect. If you keep doing this for all the disturbing images that appear, the instagram algorithm should learn to show fewer images like that. Good luck!
You need to remove your phone number from the new account. You friends who have your number, are able to find the account because the number is linked.
nope

WRITING.TITLE: Is this Manifestation?
WRITING.TEXT: There have been a number of occasions where I've thought of something obscure and particular, and I would end up seeing either an ad online for that particular thing, somehow even though I never searched for it. Or someone in my feed will post about that particular thing. This doesn't necessarily happen when I've actively meditated or tried to manifest it. Has anyone experienced this, or know why it happens?
I've had a few experiences like that. It's pretty wild!
Literally same situation as you. The explore page often seems to be filled with silly memes I can't relate to. Unfortunately, there's no way to remove the explore page.
I'm female
Really? That's so uncalled for. I couldn't react angrily at the time because I had no idea what he was talking about. And when I asked what pork has to do with anything, he merely shrugged me off.
That's where my head is at right now...
Is that really what that means? I've long had issues with my tonsils since childhood. For some reason my previous doctors have avoided me getting them removed altogether.

Thank you for your different perspective. I have never heard of that. However *if* that were the case, I must say, that as a doctor offering medical advice to someone, he should have explained what he meant, when I asked. If it was a joke/reference to some folklore, it would have helped to make it clear. The whole reason I felt he had some dubious and negative undertone, was because he brushed me off. Almost as if he didn't want to own what he was really saying. #8203; gt;Was he (or are you) Jewish, Muslim, or Seventh Day Adventist? I don't know his religion actually, nor do I belong to those. But I am aware that there are some religious beliefs surrounding pork, now that you mention. But I wasn't aware of pork in relation to tonsils.
They're just money hungry.
Thanks. I'm 25f. He's 28m. To be honest, I don't think I'd like to pursue it any further. I was just curious about what his intention could be, as he was pointing out things he already knew.
Thanks, girl. There's really guys out here in their late 20's acting silly. lol.
Never slept with him. This was a first date, if you bothered to read my post.

WRITING.TITLE: Why do people always laugh at me?
WRITING.TEXT: I am generally a reserved an introverted person personality wise. I like to think I'm someone who treats other people well and with respect. I'm not rude generally, and I often get told I'm kind. What I can't figure out is, why do people always laugh at me without explanation. There've been times where I've confronted the people in question head on. But they always either deflect and insist that they weren't laughing at me (even though they were looking right at me), or they just keep quiet. There was one time I was sitting alone in a coffee shop near the campus of my college. There were several other people seated there alone and working on their laptops as well. This other guy who I studied with literally walked into the coffee shop and came to where I was sitting and started laughing. He was like "Haha, so you're just sitting here on your own lol." Up until now I genuinely don't understand what was so humorous about the situation. Why was it funny? Whenever I try to put myself in the position of these people and figure out why something is worth laughing at, I can't place it. I don't see it? I feel like I present myself well. I shower, I dress decently, I do my hair and a little makeup. So I don't think I'm out there just looking a mess hence people laugh. Is it my quiet demeanour? Do I physically look strange? I can't figure out what is wrong with me. Why would people just laugh at someone?
Do you mind elaborating? Do you mean, he just wanted to show that I would go out with him if he asked?
I see. I have no intention to see this guy again. I was just trying to figure out what exactly his intention was. But thanks!

It's not people I don't know. It's people I work with and people I go to college with. gt;I highly doubt someone would laugh at you at complete random They would actually. I don't think it's at random, there must be a reason behind it. If you've never been in the situation, it's easy to believe it isn't happening. I don't know if I come across as quiet and awkward, so perhaps that's why. Nevertheless, thank you for your response.

I understand what you saying. Fair. But what about the guy in the coffee shop? How does one explain that, if it is all imagination and self absorption? It's not that I want to have dim outlook, but instances like this seem to validate what I think.

WRITING.TITLE: Does being polite and introverted make other people more inclined to be rude to you?
WRITING.TEXT: I experience people being notably rude towards me a lot. I am an introvert, so I am quiet natured overall. But I do think I treat other people well, as I am less inclined to be conflictual or mean. Does this personality type make one more prone to being mistreated? I just find that people are usually sarcastic and in some cases derogatory towards me. And I can't figure out why as I was communicating well with them. For instance, I had a lecturer at university who literally cursed me out in front of everyone, because SHE had misplaced one of my essays. She found it afterwards, but I can't imagine she would have spoken to anyone else like that. She seems very talkative and welcoming towards other people. I understand that there are assholes out there in the world. Not everyone is nice, I know. But I experience this quite often, and I'm wondering if my personality is the problem. Do I seem meek, hence people feel bold enough to be disrespectful? *edit: do people dislike people who are polite and/or introverts?
I'm not from the U.S. either. But it's odd to think people apparently have to be rude to each other to be respected.

That makes sense. But why is it so necessary to portray dominance? Can two people not just respect each other on an equal footing? I'm much different to you in the latter respect. If someone is rude to me I tend to steer clear of them if it's not necessary that I must be around them. I certainly don't pander for approval.
What are you talking about?
Thank you. I will check it out!
Thanks! I'll check out the book!
Yes, sounds like you're blocked.

WRITING.TITLE: Why do people I've unfollowed appear in my explore page?
WRITING.TEXT: Does this happen with all Instagram accounts? It's a little annoying, I specifically unfollowed these people because I didn't want to see their posts anymore. Yet they keep showing up in explore. Is this a glitch?
It was around midday on a Wednesday. And we went out for brunch on a Saturday.

Well, if I look beyond the comments, I suppose it was decent. Initially the conversation had been flowing well enough. But I was thrown off by these remarks, as I couldn't understand why he would reach out to start with. I was not pursuing him before that.
He really has a lot of nerve, acting like he's doing me a favor. I was not communicating with him or pursuing him in any way before he reached out.
He did reach out afterwards. But as I was annoyed by the comments and confused about his intentions, I haven't gotten back to him. I don't think I want someone who plays these needless games.

I've definitely been in this situation before. Personally I've just chosen not to reach out again, if the person doesn't respond to my last text. I figure that they would have seen it eventually, even if they were busy when you texted. However, if in your case, you really feel like the conversation was going well, and there appears to be a genuine interest on her part, by all means try again after a day or so. If you still get nothing, then leave it at that.

So true. There really are just pricks in the world who want to manipulate and put others down based on how shitty they feel about themselves. The guy who said this to you was just hurt, and wanted to spread the feeling.

I agree that he is really toxic. The interesting thing about him, was that he exhibited this behaviour very early on. From observation, a lot of the time these abuser types will act all nice and sweet in the beginning and then switch on you afterwards when you're emotionally invested. I most definitely haven't stuck around.

WRITING.TITLE: If I don't add my phone number on IG, can contacts still find the account?
WRITING.TEXT: I made a brand new Instagram that I would like to keep away from people I know, as I'm working on a new project. I created the account using a new email address, and linked it to a new throwaway Facebook account that has none of my friends. I also did not add my phone number. I keep getting a notification saying: "Add your phone number xxxxxxx (my actual number) so you can reset your password..." So Instagram somehow has my number even though I did not enter it and it is not saved in the profile settings. Does this notification mean that people who have my number can find my account? Even though I did not add it?

I had actually deactivated my original Instagram back in March. So I have not been using IG at all on this device. I downloaded it again recently and made the new one. The two are not on the same device as the other has been deactivated for a while. My concern was the phone number linkage. But if understand you correctly, people shouldn't be able to find the account if I've done all the above, and also the old account is deactivated and not on this device?

WRITING.TITLE: People I've unfollowed keep showing up in my explore page
WRITING.TEXT: Is this a common experience? There are a few accounts that I have deliberately unfollowed, because I don't want to see their posts anymore. Yet, for whatever reason, Instagram keeps bringing these people's post up in my explore. Is this a common experience or a glitch?
Thanks for the insightful information, you useless asshole.
cunt

WRITING.TITLE: Uncontrollable Telepathy
WRITING.TEXT: I'm having this weird experience where people are literally saying my own internal thoughts out loud. I'm being dead serious. Things that I think to myself on a personal level, are somehow becoming known to others , as they repeat my thoughts verbatim. I have also had uncanny experiences where people have responded with strange accuracy to internal questions I have or thoughts. Sometimes I feel like I don't get the other person's genuine independent perspective on something during a discussion, as people seem to oddly respond to me with my own perspective on the matter. How is this happening? Why is it happening? How do I make it stop.

Thank you very much. This makes a lot of sense. I can relate to what you are saying about hearing and seeing it in other places. I was hoping there was a way to eradicate this experience altogether though... I will definitely check out the book. May I ask how long have you been experiencing this?

Thank you so much. You don't understand how incredibly reassuring it is to encounter someone who knows exactly what I am talking about. This has been a rather lonely experience. I've been so confused. It's like wandering in the dark with no sense of direction. gt;I #8217;ve avoided crowds, and other people, and it started coming through in other ways. Yes. Exactly. EXACTLY!! The wildest things have happened. The craziest synchronicities. I've also received external answers to questions I've had only on the inside. It's only in moments like these where I find a little peace as it doesn't seem all that bad. But it has been a very drastic contrast between what my previous normal was, and what it is now. And so, naturally, my mind wants to revert to what felt like home before. gt;Our entire planet is going though some fairly abrupt changes, right now. Yes. I did recognise early that things are very strange, as of late. The world definitely feels like it has shifted. But I am still trying figure out for what reason. What is going on? Why was awakening necessary? I'm hoping I will find these answers eventually. I will be on the look out for people I can connect with on this level in real life. It must be really nice for you to have people who don't meet you with scepticism or doubt, and who share in your experience. I hope developing an understanding of things will bring me peace in the long run.

Thank you. I agree with your theory about sending and receiving. I have experienced people doing things that I was thinking about doing. But the more common one is them saying what I've thought to my self. It's very undeniable and precise. It is very frustrating when people just respond to me with my own thought, because then it feels like I'm just talking to myself, in a weird way. I really hope I can get a handle on this, if it is possible to control it. My best case scenario is if I can make it dormant, to be honest. But it's honestly great to find that there are other people like me out there.

I used to feel like this. I would feel all excited and proud of a photograph, eager to post it. And then some later, regret that I posted it. But I've learned two things from this: 1) The only reason why the image feels like it's distorted or not good enough after you've posted it, is because you've spent too long looking at it and analyzing it, and nit-picking minor flaws that nobody else would notice. Over familiarity from studying the image for too long is what makes the brain tired of it, or even makes it develop an aversion to it. 2) Most people are inundated with visuals on Instagram. They come across many posts. Honestly, no one is fixating on your post as much as you probably think they are, because very shortly after seeing your post, they will see another, and then another after that. While people may take the time out to regard your post by liking it, but no one is really focusing on the minor details that much at all. This is very helpful to know, when you start to feel insecure. I think sometimes when things concern ourselves, perceived imperfections seem much more significant than they are to the next person. You pictures are probably just perfectly fine, and you're over thinking it.

Thank you for your response. However, I have to kindly disagree with this theory. The reason why I disagree is because, people have at times told me deeply personal thoughts that I've had. Stuff that is specific to me and very private. Things I haven't told anyone. I'm not simply referring to generic ideas that simply could have been in the atmosphere. This is why this whole issue is very problematic to me, and I need to find a way to make it stop. It's like I have no personal space. The only thing is, as other commenters have mentioned, when I question what the person says, or how they know, they always give some random answer. Other people don't seem to be aware they are receiving in this way. I do believe there is something taking place at an underlying spiritual level here, however, I don't think it is a matter of me being the minds of others in the way you describe.
Yes, I have definitely experienced this.

Hi. To answer your question, my experience is similar for the most part, particularly with reference to what you're saying about timing. It always feel a little bit too convenient or coincidental. gt; (Unsurprising you might say, because the water was really clear and other people could notice and comment on it too, but the timing was odd.) This is where I find my experience sort of differs from yours. I'm not saying your experience is not real, so please don't misunderstand me. I have definitely experience what you're describing at times. People don't always necessarily tell me about things that are commonly agreeable. That is, we're both in the same situation, hence we're both likely to think the same thing, or to make the same inferences based on reasoning. This is not the case. What I'm experiencing is that people, in some cases, repeat really personal things, private things, that I've that I've never told anyone or thought only to myself. Or sometimes, if it's not private per se, it's just very oddly specific. As in, it's not just a thought that we both could have had, because we are both in the same situation at the same time. Examples: 1) I run an internet based business. I was searching online for some very specific products online for the sake of my business. These were totally new products, and somewhat unrelated to what I typically sell on the website. I never discussed this with anyone. Never mention these products, or my interest in them, to a soul. Later that very same day, my dad was like "I know you've been searching for "x" for your business". I was completely shocked. I asked how he knows. Why would he just think I need this unrelated product for my business?? He seemed not to know why he said that at all. 2) I very briefly dated a guy named \*Frederick (not really his name)..He was from Europe. It was very brief. Just a few dates. Because of how incredibly short-lived the whole thing was, I had never mentioned him or his name to anybody. Not to my friends or family or anyone. A couple of months down the line, after the whole thing had passed, my brother just casually brought his name in a conversation. He was was like, "Remember that French guy, Frederick?". I was totally shocked. How did he know? I questioned him about this. But he kept insisting he was referring to somebody else that I don't know. But then why did he ask me if I remember Frederick? I asked who is this Frederick he was talking about. He said he must have heard it on tv??? I got the feeling he didn't actually know who or what he was talking about... Interestingly on a separate occasion about a day or two later, another person and myself were working on a project together. They had created an account on a particular website. They then shared the password with me so I could also have access. I was surprised when they gave me the password, and the first 4 letters of the password, were the first 4 letters of "Frederick's" name. I asked, did you have a particular name in mind when you created this password, and they insisted they didn't. I was amused by the fact that two separate people for some reason had hinted at the same person. #8203; There are many other examples and occurrences of what I've experienced. I'm not sure I've chosen good ones to give here. But the fact that people just seem to know things I never told them, even if they can't explain why, is rather disconcerting.

My suggestion is to create a new throwaway Facebook account. Do not add any of your friends/family, just leave it blank. Then, link the Instagram account to the new Facebook. That way it won't suggest friends from your main Facebook and vice versa. Also, switch devices, as another commenter said. Also do not link your phone number to the account. And use an entirely new email address. Good luck.

In my personal experience, it may not be that you did anything wrong. Something could be going on in her life that is taking her attention away from you. It could also be that, perhaps she simply was not ready to pursue a relationship, and she is afraid to face you directly and tell you. Which sucks, since she is aware that you were interested. I really understand how this treatment hurts and how it can occupy your mind as result. But really just try to make peace with it especially if you know you didn't do anything wrong to upset her on your end. Try and focus on other things. Immerse yourself in work or hobbies. I strongly wouldn't recommend trying to quickly find someone to replace her if she meant a lot to you. Just reassure yourself that you are not at fault, and allow yourself to heal.
She could be really busy. So perhaps just ask her straight up what's going on.

Have you perhaps tried techniques like improving the lighting and angles of your photograph? Maybe your photos are not doing you justice. I say this because I've met guys in person who I thought were relatively average looking in their photo's, only to be startled by how completely attractive they were in person. That said, it is very difficult for us to help you here, as we cannot see what you look like.

I have never heard of an Instagram ID number. I've even googled that, and only illegitimate websites come up and they only vaguely talk about that. Instagram itself does not mention this on their official website. I think whoever is claiming they have your Instagram ID number is really just trying to make you paranoid. They are continuing the harassment by emotional manipulation. You have nothing to worry about, there is no such thing as an instagram ID number. Just block all of them and change your username.

WRITING.TITLE: What exactly do people aim to achieve by "Negging"?
WRITING.TEXT: I recently came across the term Negging for the first time. I had been experiencing this with a guy, but I was not aware that it was an actual thing, like a tactic that people do. This guy had gone out of his way to pursue me for a long time. I had been politely rejecting him previously because I simply wasn't ready for dating or getting into a relationship etc. I eventually agreed to go out with him about 10 months down the line. But the guy wound up being a complete jerk when we went out. He kept telling me about how he actually prefers taller girls (I'm 5'1). He said he hates when girls do their hair like I do mine. He said I'm a little too light skinned for him, he doesn't usually go for my complexion etc etc... Was all of this really supposed to get me to like him somehow? I was confused about why he asked me out if he thinks all of this about me. If anything I was put off by him. What is the point of negging exactly?

I no longer speak to this person on the basis that I felt like he was being a dick. I was really put off by all the stuff he said. I'm asking this question as I am just curious about whether men who do this are are actually seeking out genuine relationships with women, or is it all just a temporary game of manipulation and power...

WRITING.TITLE: People seem to matter to me, more than I matter to them...
WRITING.TEXT: So I'm rather quiet natured, and I tend to keep myself often. I'm actually not really bothered by the fact that people don't really reach out to me as much, honestly. But my issue is, I seem to care a lot about other people. I think of them, wonder how they're doing etc. But it appears I'm quite forgettable them. I'm not necessarily over here wanting to be more memorable to the people in question (friends, love interests etc), as I feel I do enough to show my interest in their lives. It's more a matter of, how do I stop caring so damn much about them? I don't know if I'm articulating the predicament correctly. I just feel like I'm in a one way street of being conscious of those who are not conscious of me. What do I do?
Will this book apply to women as well? I'm female...
Lol, no worries, I didn't exactly spell it out. I'll check it out or find an equivalent. Thanks!
You can delete from both sides. Just choose "unsend" as opposed to just "delete"

WRITING.TITLE: Are spiritual awakenings supposed to be hard/challenging?
WRITING.TEXT: Long story short, I was informed that what I am experiencing is a spiritual awakening of sorts. I began to experience really crazy synchronicities. And at times, it's as if the universe is communicating with me in different ways. But this has been a very emotionally draining experience. Very difficult, and I'm not entirely sure where the journey leads to. My main issue is that it feels like my emotions and mind are being toyed with by some unseen force. When I begin to feel good about this journey, something pulls me down again. Is the normal? Is this how an awakening is meant to go? I did not ask for this by any means and I really want my life to just return to normal. Please help.
Really? So hypothetically, if someone was reasonably/conventionally attractive, the lack of a smile is an instant no for you? May I ask why?

I see. I suppose I should take that it into account. But as you're saying, the person could still be miserable in real life. I just found it interesting because I've definitely swiped right on guys who were not smiling. They didn't look unhappy though. If that makes sense. Like it didn't even occur to me that they weren't't smiling, I just found them attractive so I said yes. But I suppose it's because I'm new to the app thing, so I have some to learn...

Lol, I see. I just find it interesting because I didn't even take smiles into account at all when I look back at my matches. gt;It #8217;s creepy to not have any smiling photos. Honestly, in my mind I would assume the person does smile in real life, like anyone in their day to day lives. If a guy is like really attractive, I wouldn't just say no because of that. If you don't mind me asking, why do think the guy I mentioned in the post would have swiped right on me, if it so unattractive not to smile? (genuine question). But thank you for your responses. Good to have some perspective and understanding.

Ok, I get you. It just never struck me that other people assess on that level. If someone was attractive and well presented then that's good enough for me... But I understand what you saying. Good to know.

First of all, when it comes to public social platforms, if everyone is free to share an opinion, then yours is more than valid as well. I also think that if (especially in a forum/comment setting) you are respectful of others, then honestly you have nothing to fear or be concerned about when expressing your view. I think you need to learn to not care so much about what other people think. Especially online when you'll most probably never meet the people you're talking to. I'm not saying be reckless, but learn not to worry.

He had probably archived the photo when you started following him, which is why you couldn't see it before. He then removed the photo from the archived section, and put it back on his main profile, which is why you could see it after.

WRITING.TITLE: Is it generally perceived negatively if you're not smiling in photos?
WRITING.TEXT: So I downloaded one of the dating apps for the first time. I got my first number of matches. And I'm just a little curious about what one of them said during our conversation. Overall, we spoke well with each other. But when I initiated the conversation he was literally like "wow, you look so serious". That was his opening message. He pointed out that I wasn't smiling in any of the photographs. None of these were group shots with friends and such. Just photos of me taken by my friend who is a professional photographer. But I'm questioning now whether it is really significant to smile in pictures in a dating app? Do people judge based on this? I feel like it's something I don't even consider about men when I swipe through profiles. Wouldn't the overall attractiveness and bio be your deciding factors on whether you say yes or no? I'm a noob so I'm working all of this out. Also, I just want to add. Based on discussions I've had, it would appear that smiling in pictures is more of a requirement for women than men for some reason. If a girl isn't smiling it is assumed she must be a bitch, whereas men can just get away with being neutral in photographs if he is attractive enough. Am I wrong? Thoughts?

So presently, what does your profile look like? All smiles? Lend me a hand, I don't know what I'm doing... But the issue isn't so much that I'm not getting matches, I am. I'm just wondering whether smiles are that significant to other people. Thanks!

gt;Now that I realized that you are a woman, lol. Why "lol"? Was it not evident in the post that I'm female? But I suppose I've only just now figured out you're a guy, so perhaps you're not the correct person to provide a workable answer. I need a girl with knowledge! #8203; Edit: I don't reckon mimicking guys would be helpful for woman. But thanks I suppose.

gt;I never saw any girls having problems finding dates anywhere I'm not having trouble finding dates. I've stated this twice now. My original question was whether smiles are really that important, based on a comment I was given by one of the guys I mentioned. And you didn't really answer that. Also, I actually have seen many posts coming from women having relationship problems on several subreddits. Guys doing them dirty, not showing interest in them, toying them around etc etc. I don't know why you seem to think dating issues are exclusive to men. But thank you, nevertheless.

WRITING.TITLE: Is it unreasonable for me to be upset over my lecturer cursing me out?
WRITING.TEXT: This happened a few months back, pre-covid. Basically I had submitted an assignment for university on time. We had to do both a digital and a physical submission. A little over a week later, my lecturer requested me to meet with her briefly. She basically told me there was some confusion over my assignment. Did I submit it or not? As she couldn't find it. I told her that I did a complete submission on the correct day and time. For me the situation wasn't that serious in that, it did not require such high anger and emotions. But my lecturer was extremely angry for some reason. She was in a state. She yelled at me in front of people, and told me that I'm lying. She proceeded to swear at me. She was being really disrespectful and rude, and it was especially uncalled for as we are both adults. The whole situation was really humiliating. The following day I was informed that my work had been found. My lecturer had made the mistake, and she did not bother to apologize. I was really angry. Even now I think about the situation and it makes me upset. The fact that she swore at me was really out of line. I feel like the institution would have protected her if I had reported it. The reason why this bothers me so much is because I find that people generally seem to think that it is okay to speak to me however they please, whereas they don't do this to other people. I experience disrespect from people often, and I don't know what it is about me. I am very quiet natured overall, so I don't know if that makes me a target. How can I move on from this situation, and going forward, what can I do when things like this occur?

I am definitely contemplating reaching out to the institution about the matter. It doesn't sit right with me that I left the situation as it was. I agree. I do think I need to assert myself more and defend myself. It's just that in this particular situation I felt conflicted now I'm the student and she's the lecturer, so there's that whole dynamic. But that certainly doesn't mean she should be allowed to get away with this behavior. Thank you, helped.

WRITING.TITLE: Could my own thinking be what causes people to be mean to me?
WRITING.TEXT: Am having trouble working out whether the cause of my troubles is law of attraction or whether the people I'm dealing with are just mean people. I experience people being really nasty to me quite often. Just general rudeness and disrespect. I am an introvert. I'm quiet natured so I don't know if that makes me a target. I don't just walk around thinking people are mean and horrible. But I have been in a negative head space overall as a result of a breakup I'm dealing with. I don't know if me generally feeling low of late is the result of the poor encounters I have with people. Or is it a simple matter of me dealing with people who are rude and abrasive? Could my head space be the cause of this, or are these separate matters?

Thank you for your response. I really do see the value of being kind to others, as I know it can have karmic consequences. Doing good will attract good and vice versa. I'm not trying victimize my self. But being an introvert means that I'm rarely, if ever, mean or confrontational towards others. As a matter of fact, in situations where I should defend myself, or where I'd be justified by reciprocating in a mean way, I don't. Which is another problem altogether. I'm specifically wondering whether simply being in a negative headspace in and of itself, as a result of life circumstances, can be the cause of the negativity one experiences. But nevertheless, thanks for the response. Being positive towards others can only yield more positivity.

I understand what you are saying. So one's mindset will influence how they perceive/experience the world. It's just hard because I've dealt with really vicious and abrasive people and it is always really unfounded. But the frequency of such encounters feels rather unnatural, which is why I'm asking this question. I suppose the best I can do is to try and lift myself out of my current mindset, despite the whole break up situation. Accept it is done and move on. Also, as the other commenter said, focus on projecting more positivity and kindness onto others, and hopefully kinder people will find their way to me.

WRITING.TITLE: Can my own thinking be what causes people to be mean to me?
WRITING.TEXT: Am having trouble working out whether the cause of my troubles is law of attraction or whether the people I'm dealing with are just mean people . I experience people being really nasty to me quite often. Just general rudeness and disrespect. I am an introvert. I'm quiet natured so I don't know if that makes me a target. I don't instigate conflict, and I often have trouble defending myself. I don't just walk around thinking people are mean and horrible. But I have been in a negative head space overall as a result of a breakup I'm dealing with. I don't know if me generally feeling low of late is the cause of the poor encounters I have with people. Or is it a simple matter of me dealing with people who are rude and abrasive? In other words, am I somehow attracting this, or am I simply attributing the independent actions of others to myself? Could my mindset be the cause of this, or are these separate matters?

Thanks for your response. But I don't quite understand. I do respect myself as person. I love treat myself well. The only faults I can say in this regard, is that when someone says something rude or disrespectful towards me, I seem to struggle with fighting back. This is especially if the person in question, is in a position of authority (like at work/university) but also in general. Is this what you are referring to?
Thank you. I will definitely give this a try.
In my experience, no. They will not shadow ban.

What do they mean by "2 services". Do they mean 2 other apps? Or the IG accounts? I've experience something similar but without that particular notification. I made a new account. And when I enter the correct password (I even wrote it down before, so that I know I'm entering the correct one). They always force me to make a new password. Every time. Have you tried deleting the app and reinstalling? If that doesn't work, I'd consider factory resetting the phone itself, as they are somehow interfering with your other applications.

That's so bizarre. Why should they care about your passwords for other apps? What business do they have in that regard?? I really feel like Facebook is overstepping boundaries by harvesting so much unnecessary data from people. I wish I could assist. But I'm afraid aside from resetting the phone, reinstalling the app I don't know what else. Perhaps contact them if there's a way? Anyway, good luck!

WRITING.TITLE: Can you post "too much" on instagram and does it result in shadowbanning?
WRITING.TEXT: I posted 3 pictures yesterday for my business account. I don't post this number everyday, I normally just post once or twice every couple of days. When I posted the 3rd picture, the hashtag reach really plummeted. Like virtually nobody saw the post and I normally get between 300 to 400 likes. I was not using the same hashtags as the previous two posts. What could cause this?
Thank you. So if I a leave a few hours between each post, that should be fine? Also, how long does the ban last?
Do you know this person in real life? If not, then you can def slide in the dms. And if they say no, then just block them and disappear. They'll forget and you will forget too.

The thing is though, the last two posts before that got 325 likes and the other 307. It doesn't appear to be a matter of nobody is engaging with the previous posts. Also as I said in my origins post, I only post once or twice every few days. So in general, I'm not spamming by any means.
No. There is no such thing.
For me, this started happening after this whole Reels mess began. Unfortunately, I don't know how to fix it. Hopefully someone who does know can answer so I can sort mine out too.

WRITING.TITLE: What could this mean?
WRITING.TEXT: During a conversation with someone, I briefly mentioned an ex of mine from a few years ago. When I woke up the next morning, I saw a notification on my phone that a stranger with exactly my ex's name and surname began to follow me on Instagram. Please bare in mind, I was not in any way trying to manifest or get my ex boyfriend back. But this seems like more than just coincidence. This is also not the first synchronicity/coincidence regarding him that has occurred. Why would this happen and what could it mean?
Thank you. I appreciate your response.
Just don't follow back only because they followed you first. Only follow people whose content you like, and don't expect reciprocation.

WRITING.TITLE: I often come across people who seem to deeply dislike me
WRITING.TEXT: It's not all people, and so I suppose in the grand scheme of things, this shouldn't bother me. But it bothers me nevertheless. Mainly because I often can't seem to place what the person's problem is. Like I would understand if we had some kind of argument or squabble about something in the past, hence we are now not on good terms. In some cases the dislike for me really seems inexplicable. I am an introvert. I am generally a very quiet natured, and I tend to avoid conflict and confrontation. But it's almost like this very trait of mine is what causes problems for reasons I can't seem to understand. Some examples. When I got my first job recently, it is a corporate job at a large company. However the specific department I was hired at is new and small, and there are only 3 other people working there at the time. Two of the people were very kind and talkative with me, but the one woman doesn't even greet back whenever I say hello. I later heard she'd been talking about me around the office in the other departments, and there was one occasion where I could clearly hear her talking about me on the phone in the other room, which I felt was deliberate. I also have an aunt who just doesn't like me for whatever reason. She's very fond of my older brother, and interacts really well with all my cousins. But she just doesn't talk to me when I'm around and when she does she always seems to have an attitude. I experienced the same thing when I was at university where there was a group of girls who just didn't like me. I also had a lecturer curse me out because *she* had misplaced my work and thought that I had caused the confusion. There are several other situations like this. I don't know what the problem with me is. And I don't mean that in a way in which I am trying to victimise myself. I mean I've genuinely done some introspection, and I don't know what it is that attracts behaviour like this towards myself. Does being quiet natured just naturally encourage extroverted people to behave this way? What can I do to deal with this issue?

WRITING.TITLE: My (21F) aunt (52F) took me to see a psychic, and everything just went south from there...
WRITING.TEXT: My aunt is a very traditional and spiritual woman. I was having some personal issues which I discussed with her, and she recommended we go and see a psychic. I am a little bit of a sceptic, but I thought I'd go along with it anyway, because what harm could it do right? So we go to the psychic man, and we discussed a lot of things. My aunt had to accompany me because there was a language barrier between myself and the guy, so she had to translate. A lot of very personal things came up during the session. Because of this, I had thought that my aunt would understand and that she would keep everything between only the two of us. A couple of days later, my cousins were all asking about stuff the psychic dude had said and if it was the truth. My aunt had basically told them everything. I was a little annoyed by this and I expressed to my one cousin that I wish my aunt had kept it quiet. My cousin then told my aunt what I said, after I had left. Now my aunt is like soooo furious. She's is really mad that I said she shouldn't have told everyone. For me this is like a really stupid thing to get upset over, but she is really angry because she says she went out of her way to help me, and this is my response to situation. She's not talking to me now. Am I wrong for feeling like certain things were personal and that I did not want to share with my whole family? I thought she would understand this. How do I rectify the situation with her? TL;DR : My aunt told my whole family personal things about me that I expected to keep private.

Absolutely, I know that now. But I didn't have the foresight prior to this. I turned to her because I saw her as a mother figure, and I thought she would be understanding. I didn't know she'd just run around and spread the story. Really disappointing.

WRITING.TITLE: So my aunt suggested we go and see a psychic, and everything went south from there...
WRITING.TEXT: My aunt is a very traditional and spiritual woman. I was having some personal issues which I discussed with her, and she recommended we go and see a psychic. I am a little bit of a sceptic, but I thought I'd go along with it anyway, because what harm could it do right? So we go to the psychic man, and we discussed a lot of things. My aunt had to accompany me because there was a language barrier between myself and the guy, so she had to translate. A lot of very personal things came up during the session. Because of this, I had thought that my aunt would understand and that she would keep everything between only the two of us. A couple of days later, my cousins were all asking about stuff the psychic dude had said and if it was the truth. My aunt had basically told them everything. I was a little annoyed by this and I expressed to my one cousin that I wish my aunt had kept it quiet. My cousin then told my aunt what I said, after I had left. Now my aunt is like soooo furious. She's is really mad that I said she shouldn't have told everyone. For me this is like a really stupid thing to get upset over, but she is really angry because she says she went out of her way to help me, and this my response to situation. She's not talking to me now. Am I wrong for feeling like certain things were personal and that I did not want to share with my whole family? I thought she would understand this.
